name: Change / Result / Preparation / Conditionals
description: Grammar patterns used to express preparation, resulting states, gradual change, directional change over time, completion/regret, and conditional logic.

entries.meaning: do in advance / do beforehand in preparation for something
entries.example_ja: 旅行の前にホテルを予約しておきます。
entries.example_en: I will reserve the hotel in advance before the trip.

entries.meaning: leave something as is / remain in a resulting state
entries.example_ja: 電気をつけたまま寝てしまいました。
entries.example_en: I fell asleep with the lights left on.

entries.meaning: come to be able to / reach a new state or habit over time
entries.example_ja: 毎日練習して、日本語が話せるようになりました。
entries.example_en: By practicing every day, I became able to speak Japanese.

entries.meaning: change or movement toward the speaker / something has started or continued up to now
entries.example_ja: だんだん寒くなってきました。

entries.meaning: change or movement away from the speaker / continue into the future
entries.example_ja: これからも日本語を勉強していきます。
entries.example_en: I will continue studying Japanese from now on.

entries.meaning: finish completely / unfortunately do / regretful completion
entries.example_ja: 宿題を忘れてしまいました。

entries.meaning: when / whenever / if (natural or automatic result, general truth)
entries.example_ja: 春になると、桜が咲きます。
entries.example_en: When spring comes, cherry blossoms bloom.

entries.meaning: if (formal, logical conditional; focuses on condition)
entries.example_ja: 時間があれば、映画を見ます。
entries.example_en: If I have time, I will watch a movie.

entries.meaning: if / when (after something happens; flexible conditional)
entries.example_ja: 雨が降ったら、家にいます。
entries.example_en: If it rains, I will stay home.

entries.meaning: if it is the case that / given that (based on context or topic)
entries.example_ja: 日本に行くなら、京都に行きたいです。
entries.example_en: If I go to Japan, I want to go to Kyoto.
